summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in css-what (CVE-2021-33587) with CVSS 7.5 severity affecting webpack build. The vulnerability allows ReDoS attacks through malformed CSS selectors with quadratic time complexity.
userImpact: Users with the TypeScript SDK build tooling are exposed to a denial-of-service vulnerability through malformed CSS selector parsing.
rootCause: css-what package versions 4.0.0-5.0.0 lack linear time complexity guarantees for attribute parsing, enabling ReDoS attacks.
proposedFix: Upgrade @svgr/webpack to version 6.0.0-alpha.0 or later, which updates css-what to 5.0.1 or higher.
resolutionDetails: Automatically resolved by WhiteSource; the vulnerable library was either marked as ignored or removed from inventory.
keyQuote: The css-what package 4.0.0 through 5.0.0 for Node.js does not ensure that attribute parsing has Linear Time Complexity
